Find search results results = soup.find_all(&#x27;div', class_='g') print(f&#x27;Found {len(results)} PDF search results') "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results[:5], 1): "keyword">try: # Extract title title_element = result.find(&#x27;h3') title = title_element.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title_element "keyword">else &#x27;No title' # Extract link link_element = result.find(&#x27;a') link = link_element.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if link_element "keyword">else '' # Extract snippet snippet_elements = result.find_all(&#x27;span') snippet = &#x27;' "keyword">for span "keyword">in snippet_elements: text = span.get_text().strip() "keyword">if len(text) > 50: # Likely to be the snippet snippet = text "keyword">break "keyword">if link "keyword">and &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in link.lower(): result_data = { &#x27;source': 'Google PDF Search', &#x27;rank': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;link': link, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;is_pdf': "keyword">True } search_results.append(result_data) print(f&#x27;\nPDF Result {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {title}') print(f&#x27; Link: {link}') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {snippet[:100]}...' "keyword">if len(snippet) > 100 "keyword">else f' Snippet: {snippet}') "keyword">if &#x27;trans fatty acid' "keyword">in title.lower() "keyword">and 'chocolate' "keyword">in title.lower(): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL PDF MATCH! ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error parsing PDF result {i}: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Google PDF search failed "keyword">with status {response.status_code}') time.sleep(2) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">with Google PDF search: {e}') # Strategy 3: Search "keyword">for related terms "keyword">and authors print(&#x27;\n=== STRATEGY 3: BROADER SEARCH FOR RELATED RESEARCH ===') "keyword">try: broader_search_terms = [ &#x27;trans fatty acid chocolate Turkey', &#x27;chocolate wafer trans fat Turkey', &#x27;Turkish chocolate trans fatty acid content', &#x27;trans fat chocolate analysis Turkey' ] "keyword">for term "keyword">in broader_search_terms: print(f&#x27;\nSearching "keyword">for: "{term}"') params = {&#x27;q': term, 'num': 10} response = requests.get(&#x27;https://www.google.com/search', params=params, headers=headers, timeout=10) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') results = soup.find_all(&#x27;div', class_='g') print(f&#x27; Found {len(results)} results') # Look "keyword">for academic sources "keyword">for result "keyword">in results[:3]: "keyword">try: title_element = result.find(&#x27;h3') title = title_element.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title_element "keyword">else &#x27;' link_element = result.find(&#x27;a') link = link_element.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if link_element "keyword">else '' # Check "keyword">for academic indicators academic_indicators = [&#x27;researchgate.net', 'academia.edu', 'pubmed', 'sciencedirect', 'springer', 'wiley', 'taylor', 'sage'] "keyword">if any(indicator "keyword">in link.lower() "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in academic_indicators): print(f&#x27; Academic source found: {title[:80]}...') print(f&#x27; Link: {link}') search_results.append({ &#x27;source': 'Broader Search', &#x27;search_term': term, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;link': link, &#x27;is_academic': "keyword">True }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: "keyword">continue time.sleep(1) # Be respectful "keyword">with requests "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">with broader search: {e}') # Save all search results search_summary = { &#x27;search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;target_paper': 'Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey', &#x27;objective': 'Find full text to access bibliography "keyword">and reference list', &#x27;total_results_found': len(search_results), &#x27;search_strategies_used': len(search_strategies), &#x27;results': search_results } # Save to file results_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json' "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(search_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Total search results collected: {len(search_results)}') print(f&#x27;Search results saved to: {results_file}') # Identify the most promising results promising_results = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in search_results: title = result.get(&#x27;title', '').lower() # Score based on title relevance score = 0 "keyword">if &#x27;trans fatty acid' "keyword">in title: score += 10 "keyword">if &#x27;chocolate' "keyword">in title: score += 8 "keyword">if &#x27;wafer' "keyword">in title: score += 5 "keyword">if &#x27;turkey' "keyword">in title: score += 7 "keyword">if &#x27;content' "keyword">in title: score += 3 "keyword">if score >= 15: # High relevance threshold result[&#x27;relevance_score'] = score promising_results.append(result) "keyword">if promising_results: promising_results.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;relevance_score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS ===') "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(promising_results, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f&#x27; Title: {result["title"]}') print(f&#x27; Source: {result["source"]}') "keyword">if &#x27;link' "keyword">in result: print(f&#x27; Link: {result["link"]}') "keyword">if &#x27;is_pdf' "keyword">in result "keyword">and result['is_pdf']: print(&#x27; *** DIRECT PDF ACCESS AVAILABLE ***') "keyword">if i == 1: print(&#x27; >>> TOP CANDIDATE FOR FULL TEXT ACCESS <<<') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nNo high-relevance results found. Will need to "keyword">try alternative approaches.') print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===') print(&#x27;Next step: Access the most promising result to retrieve the full paper text "keyword">and bibliography')

"keyword">import json "keyword">import os # First, let's inspect the search results file to understand its structure search_results_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json' print(&#x27;=== INSPECTING SEARCH RESULTS FILE STRUCTURE ===') "keyword">if os.path.exists(search_results_file): print(f&#x27;Search results file exists: {search_results_file}') # Load "keyword">and inspect the structure "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\nTop-level keys "keyword">in search data:') "keyword">for key "keyword">in search_data.keys(): "keyword">if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f&#x27; - {key}: list "keyword">with {len(search_data[key])} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f&#x27; - {key}: dict "keyword">with keys {list(search_data[key].keys())}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; - {key}: {search_data[key]}') # Inspect the results structure "keyword">if &#x27;results' "keyword">in search_data: results = search_data[&#x27;results'] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(results)} search results') "keyword">if results: print(&#x27;\nFirst result structure:') first_result = results[0] "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in first_result.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; - {key}: list "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; - {key}: {str(value)[:100]}...' "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] print(f&#x27;Available workspace directories: {workspace_dirs}') "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: potential_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(potential_file): search_results_file = potential_file print(f&#x27;Found search results file at: {search_results_file}') "keyword">break # 📝 Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== ACCESSING TARGET PAPER FOR BIBLIOGRAPHY EXTRACTION ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Retrieve full text "keyword">and extract complete reference list "keyword">with numbering') print(&#x27;Target: "Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey"\n') # Load the search results to get the ProQuest link search_results_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json' "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(search_results_file): # Check alternative workspace locations workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: potential_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(potential_file): search_results_file = potential_file "keyword">break print(f&#x27;Loading search results "keyword">from: {search_results_file}') "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: search_data = json.load(f) # Extract the ProQuest link target_link = "keyword">None "keyword">for result "keyword">in search_data.get(&#x27;results', []): "keyword">if &#x27;trans fatty acid' "keyword">in result.get('title', '').lower() "keyword">and 'chocolate' "keyword">in result.get('title', '').lower(): links = result.get(&#x27;links', []) "keyword">if links: target_link = links[0] # Primary link "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_link: print(&#x27;Error: Could "keyword">not find target paper link "keyword">in search results') exit(1) print(f&#x27;Target paper link: {target_link}') # Headers to mimic a regular browser headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS PROQUEST PAPER ===\n') "keyword">try: # Access the ProQuest paper print(&#x27;Requesting paper "keyword">from ProQuest...') response = requests.get(target_link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Save the raw HTML "keyword">for inspection raw_html_file = &#x27;workspace/proquest_paper_raw.html' "keyword">with open(raw_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;Raw HTML saved to: {raw_html_file}') # Try to extract the paper content print(&#x27;\n=== EXTRACTING PAPER CONTENT ===\n') # Look "keyword">for common content containers "keyword">in ProQuest content_selectors = [ &#x27;div.documentContent', &#x27;div.fullTextZone', &#x27;div.abstract_content', &#x27;div.document-content', &#x27;div#documentContent', &#x27;div.document_content', &#x27;article', &#x27;main', &#x27;div.content' ] paper_content = "keyword">None content_source = "keyword">None "keyword">for selector "keyword">in content_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: paper_content = elements[0].get_text(separator=&#x27;\n').strip() content_source = selector print(f&#x27;Found content using selector: {selector}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(paper_content):,} characters') "keyword">break # If no specific selectors work, "keyword">try to get all text "keyword">if "keyword">not paper_content: print(&#x27;Specific selectors failed, extracting all text content...') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() paper_content = soup.get_text(separator=&#x27;\n') content_source = &#x27;full_page_text' print(f&#x27;Full page text length: {len(paper_content):,} characters') "keyword">if paper_content "keyword">and len(paper_content) > 1000: print(&#x27;\n*** PAPER CONTENT SUCCESSFULLY EXTRACTED ***') # Save the extracted content content_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_content.txt' "keyword">with open(content_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TRANS FATTY ACID PAPER CONTENT\n') f.write(f&#x27;Retrieved "keyword">from: {target_link}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Extraction method: {content_source}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Content length: {len(paper_content):,} characters\n') f.write(f&#x27;Extraction timestamp: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 80 + '\n\n') f.write(paper_content) print(f&#x27;Paper content saved to: {content_file}') # Now search "keyword">for bibliography/references section print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR BIBLIOGRAPHY/REFERENCES SECTION ===\n') # Common reference section indicators ref_indicators = [ &#x27;references', &#x27;bibliography', &#x27;cited literature', &#x27;literature cited', &#x27;works cited', &#x27;reference list' ] content_lower = paper_content.lower() # Find references section ref_section_start = -1 ref_indicator_found = "keyword">None "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in ref_indicators: # Look "keyword">for the indicator "keyword">as a section heading patterns = [ f&#x27;\n{indicator}\n', f&#x27;\n{indicator}:', f&#x27;\n{indicator} \n', f&#x27;{indicator}\n\n' ] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in patterns: pos = content_lower.find(pattern) "keyword">if pos != -1: ref_section_start = pos ref_indicator_found = indicator print(f&#x27;Found references section: "{indicator}" at position {pos}') "keyword">break "keyword">if ref_section_start != -1: "keyword">break "keyword">if ref_section_start != -1: # Extract the references section ref_section = paper_content[ref_section_start:] # Try to find where references end (usually before acknowledgments, appendix, etc.) end_indicators = [ &#x27;acknowledgment', &#x27;acknowledgement', &#x27;appendix', &#x27;author information', &#x27;corresponding author', &#x27;conflict of interest', &#x27;funding', &#x27;ethical approval' ] ref_section_end = len(ref_section) "keyword">for end_indicator "keyword">in end_indicators: pos = ref_section.lower().find(end_indicator) "keyword">if pos != -1 "keyword">and pos < ref_section_end: ref_section_end = pos ref_section = ref_section[:ref_section_end].strip() print(f&#x27;References section extracted ({len(ref_section):,} characters)') # Save the references section ref_file = &#x27;workspace/paper_references_section.txt' "keyword">with open(ref_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;REFERENCES SECTION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source: Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey\n') f.write(f&#x27;Section indicator: {ref_indicator_found}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Section length: {len(ref_section):,} characters\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 60 + '\n\n') f.write(ref_section) print(f&#x27;References section saved to: {ref_file}') # Parse individual references print(&#x27;\n=== PARSING INDIVIDUAL REFERENCES ===\n') # Split references by common patterns lines = ref_section.split(&#x27;\n') references = [] current_ref = &#x27;' ref_number = 0 "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line = line.strip() "keyword">if "keyword">not line: "keyword">if current_ref: # End of current reference references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) current_ref = &#x27;' "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if line starts "keyword">with a number (new reference) number_match = re.match(r&#x27;^(\d+)[.)\s]', line) "keyword">if number_match: # Save previous reference "keyword">if exists "keyword">if current_ref "keyword">and ref_number > 0: references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) # Start new reference ref_number = int(number_match.group(1)) current_ref = line[number_match.end():].strip() "keyword">else: # Continue current reference "keyword">if current_ref: current_ref += &#x27; ' + line "keyword">else: current_ref = line # Add final reference "keyword">if current_ref "keyword">and ref_number > 0: references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) print(f&#x27;Parsed {len(references)} individual references') # Display parsed references "keyword">for ref "keyword">in references[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f&#x27;\nRef {ref["number"]}: {ref["text"][:100]}...' "keyword">if len(ref["text"]) > 100 "keyword">else f'\nRef {ref["number"]}: {ref["text"]}') "keyword">if len(references) > 10: print(f&#x27;\n... "keyword">and {len(references) - 10} more references') # Save parsed references parsed_refs_file = &#x27;workspace/parsed_references.json' "keyword">with open(parsed_refs_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;source_paper': 'Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey', &#x27;total_references': len(references), &#x27;extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;references': references }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nParsed references saved to: {parsed_refs_file}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;References section "keyword">not found "keyword">in the paper content') print(&#x27;\nTrying alternative approach: searching "keyword">for numbered citations...') # Look "keyword">for numbered citations "keyword">in the text citation_pattern = r&#x27;\[\d+\]|\(\d+\)' citations = re.findall(citation_pattern, paper_content) "keyword">if citations: print(f&#x27;Found {len(citations)} numbered citations: {citations[:20]}') # Extract unique citation numbers citation_numbers = set() "keyword">for citation "keyword">in citations: number = re.search(r&#x27;\d+', citation) "keyword">if number: citation_numbers.add(int(number.group())) sorted_numbers = sorted(citation_numbers) print(f&#x27;Citation numbers found: {sorted_numbers[:20]}...' "keyword">if len(sorted_numbers) > 20 "keyword">else f'Citation numbers found: {sorted_numbers}') print(f&#x27;Highest reference number: {max(sorted_numbers) "keyword">if sorted_numbers "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No numbered citations found') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Insufficient content extracted "keyword">from the paper') print(f&#x27;Content preview: {paper_content[:500] "keyword">if paper_content "keyword">else "No content"}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Failed to access paper. Status code: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing paper: {e}') "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() print(&#x27;\n=== PAPER ACCESS ATTEMPT COMPLETE ===') print(&#x27;Next step: Analyze extracted references "keyword">and match "keyword">with Excel table titles')
📄 Output

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 04:45:14

Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully accessed the ProQuest paper link, retrieving some content from the target paper. However, the extracted content is insufficient for completing the **PLAN** requirements. The code found only 249 characters of content which appears to be mostly metadata (title, authors, journal info) rather than the full paper text containing the bibliography. While the code successfully identified the paper and saved raw HTML to 'workspace/proquest_paper_raw.html', it could not locate the references section needed to extract the numbered bibliography. **PLAN** alignment: 70% complete - paper successfully located and accessed, but bibliography extraction failed due to limited content retrieval. The output suggests the ProQuest page may require authentication or the content extraction selectors need refinement. Recommend: (1) Examine the saved raw HTML file to understand the page structure, (2) Try alternative content extraction methods or selectors, (3) Consider if the ProQuest link requires institutional access, (4) Look for alternative sources of the full paper text with accessible references section.

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== ACCESSING TARGET PAPER FOR BIBLIOGRAPHY EXTRACTION ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Retrieve full text "keyword">and extract complete reference list "keyword">with numbering') print(&#x27;Target: "Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey"\n') # Load the search results to get the ProQuest link search_results_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json' "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(search_results_file): # Check alternative workspace locations workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: potential_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;trans_fatty_acid_paper_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(potential_file): search_results_file = potential_file "keyword">break print(f&#x27;Loading search results "keyword">from: {search_results_file}') "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: search_data = json.load(f) # Extract the ProQuest link target_link = "keyword">None "keyword">for result "keyword">in search_data.get(&#x27;results', []): "keyword">if &#x27;trans fatty acid' "keyword">in result.get('title', '').lower() "keyword">and 'chocolate' "keyword">in result.get('title', '').lower(): links = result.get(&#x27;links', []) "keyword">if links: target_link = links[0] # Primary link "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_link: print(&#x27;Error: Could "keyword">not find target paper link "keyword">in search results') exit(1) print(f&#x27;Target paper link: {target_link}') # Headers to mimic a regular browser headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS PROQUEST PAPER ===\n') "keyword">try: # Access the ProQuest paper print(&#x27;Requesting paper "keyword">from ProQuest...') response = requests.get(target_link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Save the raw HTML "keyword">for inspection raw_html_file = &#x27;workspace/proquest_paper_raw.html' "keyword">with open(raw_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;Raw HTML saved to: {raw_html_file}') # Try to extract the paper content print(&#x27;\n=== EXTRACTING PAPER CONTENT ===\n') # Look "keyword">for common content containers "keyword">in ProQuest content_selectors = [ &#x27;div.documentContent', &#x27;div.fullTextZone', &#x27;div.abstract_content', &#x27;div.document-content', &#x27;div#documentContent', &#x27;div.document_content', &#x27;article', &#x27;main', &#x27;div.content' ] paper_content = "keyword">None content_source = "keyword">None "keyword">for selector "keyword">in content_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: paper_content = elements[0].get_text(separator=&#x27;\n').strip() content_source = selector print(f&#x27;Found content using selector: {selector}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(paper_content):,} characters') "keyword">break # If no specific selectors work, "keyword">try to get all text "keyword">if "keyword">not paper_content: print(&#x27;Specific selectors failed, extracting all text content...') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() paper_content = soup.get_text(separator=&#x27;\n') content_source = &#x27;full_page_text' print(f&#x27;Full page text length: {len(paper_content):,} characters') "keyword">if paper_content "keyword">and len(paper_content) > 1000: print(&#x27;\n*** PAPER CONTENT SUCCESSFULLY EXTRACTED ***') # Save the extracted content content_file = &#x27;workspace/trans_fatty_acid_paper_content.txt' "keyword">with open(content_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TRANS FATTY ACID PAPER CONTENT\n') f.write(f&#x27;Retrieved "keyword">from: {target_link}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Extraction method: {content_source}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Content length: {len(paper_content):,} characters\n') f.write(f&#x27;Extraction timestamp: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 80 + '\n\n') f.write(paper_content) print(f&#x27;Paper content saved to: {content_file}') # Now search "keyword">for bibliography/references section print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR BIBLIOGRAPHY/REFERENCES SECTION ===\n') # Common reference section indicators ref_indicators = [ &#x27;references', &#x27;bibliography', &#x27;cited literature', &#x27;literature cited', &#x27;works cited', &#x27;reference list' ] content_lower = paper_content.lower() # Find references section ref_section_start = -1 ref_indicator_found = "keyword">None "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in ref_indicators: # Look "keyword">for the indicator "keyword">as a section heading patterns = [ f&#x27;\n{indicator}\n', f&#x27;\n{indicator}:', f&#x27;\n{indicator} \n', f&#x27;{indicator}\n\n' ] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in patterns: pos = content_lower.find(pattern) "keyword">if pos != -1: ref_section_start = pos ref_indicator_found = indicator print(f&#x27;Found references section: "{indicator}" at position {pos}') "keyword">break "keyword">if ref_section_start != -1: "keyword">break "keyword">if ref_section_start != -1: # Extract the references section ref_section = paper_content[ref_section_start:] # Try to find where references end (usually before acknowledgments, appendix, etc.) end_indicators = [ &#x27;acknowledgment', &#x27;acknowledgement', &#x27;appendix', &#x27;author information', &#x27;corresponding author', &#x27;conflict of interest', &#x27;funding', &#x27;ethical approval' ] ref_section_end = len(ref_section) "keyword">for end_indicator "keyword">in end_indicators: pos = ref_section.lower().find(end_indicator) "keyword">if pos != -1 "keyword">and pos < ref_section_end: ref_section_end = pos ref_section = ref_section[:ref_section_end].strip() print(f&#x27;References section extracted ({len(ref_section):,} characters)') # Save the references section ref_file = &#x27;workspace/paper_references_section.txt' "keyword">with open(ref_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;REFERENCES SECTION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source: Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey\n') f.write(f&#x27;Section indicator: {ref_indicator_found}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Section length: {len(ref_section):,} characters\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 60 + '\n\n') f.write(ref_section) print(f&#x27;References section saved to: {ref_file}') # Parse individual references print(&#x27;\n=== PARSING INDIVIDUAL REFERENCES ===\n') # Split references by common patterns lines = ref_section.split(&#x27;\n') references = [] current_ref = &#x27;' ref_number = 0 "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line = line.strip() "keyword">if "keyword">not line: "keyword">if current_ref: # End of current reference references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) current_ref = &#x27;' "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if line starts "keyword">with a number (new reference) number_match = re.match(r&#x27;^(\d+)[.)\s]', line) "keyword">if number_match: # Save previous reference "keyword">if exists "keyword">if current_ref "keyword">and ref_number > 0: references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) # Start new reference ref_number = int(number_match.group(1)) current_ref = line[number_match.end():].strip() "keyword">else: # Continue current reference "keyword">if current_ref: current_ref += &#x27; ' + line "keyword">else: current_ref = line # Add final reference "keyword">if current_ref "keyword">and ref_number > 0: references.append({&#x27;number': ref_number, 'text': current_ref.strip()}) print(f&#x27;Parsed {len(references)} individual references') # Display parsed references "keyword">for ref "keyword">in references[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f&#x27;\nRef {ref["number"]}: {ref["text"][:100]}...' "keyword">if len(ref["text"]) > 100 "keyword">else f'\nRef {ref["number"]}: {ref["text"]}') "keyword">if len(references) > 10: print(f&#x27;\n... "keyword">and {len(references) - 10} more references') # Save parsed references parsed_refs_file = &#x27;workspace/parsed_references.json' "keyword">with open(parsed_refs_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;source_paper': 'Trans fatty acid contents "keyword">in chocolates "keyword">and chocolate wafers "keyword">in Turkey', &#x27;total_references': len(references), &#x27;extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;references': references }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nParsed references saved to: {parsed_refs_file}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;References section "keyword">not found "keyword">in the paper content') print(&#x27;\nTrying alternative approach: searching "keyword">for numbered citations...') # Look "keyword">for numbered citations "keyword">in the text citation_pattern = r&#x27;\[\d+\]|\(\d+\)' citations = re.findall(citation_pattern, paper_content) "keyword">if citations: print(f&#x27;Found {len(citations)} numbered citations: {citations[:20]}') # Extract unique citation numbers citation_numbers = set() "keyword">for citation "keyword">in citations: number = re.search(r&#x27;\d+', citation) "keyword">if number: citation_numbers.add(int(number.group())) sorted_numbers = sorted(citation_numbers) print(f&#x27;Citation numbers found: {sorted_numbers[:20]}...' "keyword">if len(sorted_numbers) > 20 "keyword">else f'Citation numbers found: {sorted_numbers}') print(f&#x27;Highest reference number: {max(sorted_numbers) "keyword">if sorted_numbers "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No numbered citations found') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Insufficient content extracted "keyword">from the paper') print(f&#x27;Content preview: {paper_content[:500] "keyword">if paper_content "keyword">else "No content"}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Failed to access paper. Status code: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing paper: {e}') "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() print(&#x27;\n=== PAPER ACCESS ATTEMPT COMPLETE ===') print(&#x27;Next step: Analyze extracted references "keyword">and match "keyword">with Excel table titles')
📄 Output

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== EXAMINING PROQUEST RAW HTML FOR ALTERNATIVE ACCESS METHODS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Analyze the saved HTML to understand ProQuest page structure "keyword">and find alternative ways to access the full paper\n') # First, let's find "keyword">and inspect the saved HTML file workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] html_file_path = "keyword">None "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: potential_html = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;proquest_paper_raw.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(potential_html): html_file_path = potential_html "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not html_file_path: print(&#x27;Raw HTML file "keyword">not found. Checking available files...') "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f&#x27;Files "keyword">in {workspace_dir}: {files}') exit(1) print(f&#x27;Found HTML file: {html_file_path}') file_size = os.path.getsize(html_file_path) print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes') # Load "keyword">and parse the HTML "keyword">with open(html_file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f&#x27;HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters') soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;HTML successfully parsed "keyword">with BeautifulSoup') # Analyze the page structure print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING PROQUEST PAGE STRUCTURE ===') # Look "keyword">for title "keyword">and basic paper information title_selectors = [&#x27;h1', 'h2', '.documentTitle', '.title', '[data-testid="title"]'] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in title_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f&#x27;\nTitle elements found "keyword">with selector "{selector}":') "keyword">for i, elem "keyword">in enumerate(elements[:3]): text = elem.get_text().strip() "keyword">if text: print(f&#x27; {i+1}. {text}') # Look "keyword">for DOI "keyword">or paper identifiers doi_patterns = [r&#x27;10\.\d+/[^\s]+', r'DOI[:\s]*([^\s]+)', r'doi[:\s]*([^\s]+)'] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in doi_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: print(f&#x27;\nDOI found "keyword">with pattern "{pattern}": {matches}') "keyword">break # Check "keyword">for PDF download links "keyword">or full text access print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR FULL TEXT ACCESS OPTIONS ===') # Look "keyword">for PDF links pdf_links = soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href=re.compile(r'\.pdf', re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">if pdf_links: print(f&#x27;PDF links found: {len(pdf_links)}') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links[:3]): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i+1}. {text} -> {href}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No direct PDF links found') # Look "keyword">for full text "keyword">or view options full_text_selectors = [ &#x27;a[href*="fulltext"]', &#x27;a[href*="pdf"]', &#x27;button[onclick*="fulltext"]', &#x27;.fullTextLink', &#x27;.pdfLink', &#x27;[data-testid*="pdf"]', &#x27;[data-testid*="fulltext"]' ] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in full_text_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f&#x27;\nFull text elements found "keyword">with "{selector}":') "keyword">for elem "keyword">in elements[:2]: text = elem.get_text().strip() href = elem.get(&#x27;href', elem.get('onclick', '')) print(f&#x27; Text: {text}, Link/Action: {href}') # Look "keyword">for Czech Journal of Food Sciences specific information print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR JOURNAL-SPECIFIC INFORMATION ===') journal_text = html_content.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;czech journal' "keyword">in journal_text: print(&#x27;Czech Journal of Food Sciences mentioned "keyword">in page') # Extract journal information context lines = html_content.split(&#x27;\n') journal_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: "keyword">if &#x27;czech journal' "keyword">in line.lower(): journal_lines.append(line.strip()) print(&#x27;Journal-related lines:') "keyword">for line "keyword">in journal_lines[:5]: print(f&#x27; {line}') # Look "keyword">for volume/issue/page information volume_pattern = r&#x27;vol\.?\s*(\d+)|volume\s*(\d+)' issue_pattern = r&#x27;iss\.?\s*(\d+)|issue\s*(\d+)|no\.?\s*(\d+)' page_pattern = r&#x27;pp?\.?\s*([\d-]+)|pages?\s*([\d-]+)' year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19|20)\d{2}\b' volume_match = re.search(volume_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) issue_match = re.search(issue_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) page_match = re.search(page_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) year_matches = re.findall(year_pattern, html_content) print(&#x27;\nPaper citation details extracted:') "keyword">if volume_match: volume = volume_match.group(1) "keyword">or volume_match.group(2) print(f&#x27; Volume: {volume}') "keyword">if issue_match: issue = issue_match.group(1) "keyword">or issue_match.group(2) "keyword">or issue_match.group(3) print(f&#x27; Issue: {issue}') "keyword">if page_match: pages = page_match.group(1) "keyword">or page_match.group(2) print(f&#x27; Pages: {pages}') "keyword">if year_matches: print(f&#x27; Years mentioned: {set(year_matches)}') # Try alternative search strategies based on extracted information print(&#x27;\n=== FORMULATING ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES ===') # Extract author names more precisely author_patterns = [ r&#x27;Çakmak[,\s]*Y[\s]*S', r&#x27;Güler[,\s]*G[\s]*Ö', r&#x27;Y[\s]*S[\s]*Çakmak', r&#x27;G[\s]*Ö[\s]*Güler' ] authors_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: authors_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if authors_found: print(f&#x27;Authors confirmed "keyword">in page: {set(authors_found)}') # Check "keyword">if there are authentication requirements auth_indicators = [ &#x27;login', 'sign "keyword">in', 'authenticate', 'institutional access', &#x27;subscription required', 'access denied', 'unauthorized' ] auth_issues = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in auth_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in html_content.lower(): auth_issues.append(indicator) "keyword">if auth_issues: print(f&#x27;\n*** AUTHENTICATION ISSUES DETECTED: {auth_issues} ***') print(&#x27;The ProQuest page may require institutional access "keyword">or subscription') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nNo obvious authentication barriers detected') # Look "keyword">for alternative sources "keyword">or mirrors mentioned print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ALTERNATIVE SOURCE INDICATORS ===') alternative_sources = [ &#x27;researchgate', 'academia.edu', 'semantic scholar', 'pubmed', &#x27;sciencedirect', 'springer', 'wiley', 'taylor', 'sage' ] found_alternatives = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in alternative_sources: "keyword">if source "keyword">in html_content.lower(): found_alternatives.append(source) "keyword">if found_alternatives: print(f&#x27;Alternative sources mentioned: {found_alternatives}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No alternative academic sources mentioned on page') # Save detailed analysis analysis_results = { &#x27;html_file_analyzed': html_file_path, &#x27;file_size_bytes': file_size, &#x27;content_length_chars': len(html_content), &#x27;paper_details': { &#x27;title_confirmed': 'trans fatty acid' "keyword">in html_content.lower() "keyword">and 'chocolate' "keyword">in html_content.lower(), &#x27;journal_confirmed': 'czech journal' "keyword">in html_content.lower(), &#x27;authors_found': list(set(authors_found)), &#x27;volume': volume_match.group(1) "keyword">or volume_match.group(2) "keyword">if volume_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;issue': issue_match.group(1) "keyword">or issue_match.group(2) "keyword">or issue_match.group(3) "keyword">if issue_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;pages': page_match.group(1) "keyword">or page_match.group(2) "keyword">if page_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;years_mentioned': list(set(year_matches)) "keyword">if year_matches "keyword">else [] }, &#x27;access_analysis': { &#x27;pdf_links_found': len(pdf_links), &#x27;authentication_issues': auth_issues, &#x27;alternative_sources_mentioned': found_alternatives }, &#x27;next_steps_recommended': [] } # Determine next steps based on analysis "keyword">if auth_issues: analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'].append('Try alternative academic databases (ResearchGate, Academia.edu, etc.)') analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'].append('Search "keyword">for open access versions of the paper') "keyword">if volume_match "keyword">and issue_match: vol_num = volume_match.group(1) "keyword">or volume_match.group(2) iss_num = issue_match.group(1) "keyword">or issue_match.group(2) "keyword">or issue_match.group(3) analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'].append(f'Direct journal access: Czech Journal of Food Sciences, Vol.{vol_num}, Issue {iss_num}') analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'].append('Search "keyword">for the paper by DOI "keyword">if available') analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'].append('Try institutional repository searches') # Save analysis analysis_file = &#x27;workspace/proquest_page_analysis.json' "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nDetailed page analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') print(&#x27;\n=== RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS ===') "keyword">for i, step "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_results[&#x27;next_steps_recommended'], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {step}') print(&#x27;\n=== PROQUEST PAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') print(&#x27;The ProQuest page contains paper metadata but appears to have access restrictions.') print(&#x27;Will need to "keyword">try alternative approaches to access the full paper "keyword">and bibliography.')

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 04:46:12

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed a comprehensive analysis of the ProQuest HTML file to understand page structure and identify alternative access methods. The analysis successfully extracted key paper metadata including DOI (10.17221/48/2009-CJFS), journal details (Czech Journal of Food Sciences, Vol. 28, Issue 3, 2010), and confirmed authors (YS Çakmak, GÖ Güler). The code identified authentication issues ('login', 'authenticate' detected) indicating the ProQuest page requires institutional access or subscription. **PLAN** alignment: 75% complete - paper located and metadata extracted, but full bibliography access blocked by authentication barriers. The analysis provided 5 recommended next steps including trying alternative academic databases (ResearchGate, Academia.edu), searching for open access versions, direct journal access via Czech Journal of Food Sciences Vol.28 Issue 3, DOI-based searches, and institutional repository searches. The detailed page analysis was saved to 'workspace/proquest_page_analysis.json' for reference. 📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== EXAMINING PROQUEST RAW HTML FOR ALTERNATIVE ACCESS METHODS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Analyze the saved HTML to understand ProQuest page structure "keyword">and find alternative ways to access the full paper\n') # First, let's find "keyword">and inspect the saved HTML file workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] html_file_path = "keyword">None "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: potential_html = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;proquest_paper_raw.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(potential_html): html_file_path = potential_html "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not html_file_path: print(&#x27;Raw HTML file "keyword">not found. Checking available files...') "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f&#x27;Files "keyword">in {workspace_dir}: {files}') exit(1) print(f&#x27;Found HTML file: {html_file_path}') file_size = os.path.getsize(html_file_path) print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes') # Load "keyword">and parse the HTML "keyword">with open(html_file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f&#x27;HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters') soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;HTML successfully parsed "keyword">with BeautifulSoup') # Analyze the page structure print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING PROQUEST PAGE STRUCTURE ===') # Look "keyword">for title "keyword">and basic paper information title_selectors = [&#x27;h1', 'h2', '.documentTitle', '.title', '[data-testid="title"]'] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in title_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f&#x27;\nTitle elements found "keyword">with selector "{selector}":') "keyword">for i, elem "keyword">in enumerate(elements[:3]): text = elem.get_text().strip() "keyword">if text: print(f&#x27; {i+1}. {text}') # Look "keyword">for DOI "keyword">or paper identifiers doi_patterns = [r&#x27;10\.\d+/[^\s]+', r'DOI[:\s]*([^\s]+)', r'doi[:\s]*([^\s]+)'] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in doi_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: print(f&#x27;\nDOI found "keyword">with pattern "{pattern}": {matches}') "keyword">break # Check "keyword">for PDF download links "keyword">or full text access print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR FULL TEXT ACCESS OPTIONS ===') # Look "keyword">for PDF links pdf_links = soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href=re.compile(r'\.pdf', re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">if pdf_links: print(f&#x27;PDF links found: {len(pdf_links)}') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links[:3]): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i+1}. {text} -> {href}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No direct PDF links found') # Look "keyword">for full text "keyword">or view options full_text_selectors = [ &#x27;a[href*="fulltext"]', &#x27;a[href*="pdf"]', &#x27;button[onclick*="fulltext"]', &#x27;.fullTextLink', &#x27;.pdfLink', &#x27;[data-testid*="pdf"]', &#x27;[data-testid*="fulltext"]' ] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in full_text_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f&#x27;\nFull text elements found "keyword">with "{selector}":') "keyword">for elem "keyword">in elements[:2]: text = elem.get_text().strip() href = elem.get(&#x27;href', elem.get('onclick', '')) print(f&#x27; Text: {text}, Link/Action: {href}') # Look "keyword">for Czech Journal of Food Sciences specific information print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR JOURNAL-SPECIFIC INFORMATION ===') journal_text = html_content.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;czech journal' "keyword">in journal_text: print(&#x27;Czech Journal of Food Sciences mentioned "keyword">in page') # Extract journal information context lines = html_content.split(&#x27;\n') journal_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: "keyword">if &#x27;czech journal' "keyword">in line.lower(): journal_lines.append(line.strip()) print(&#x27;Journal-related lines:') "keyword">for line "keyword">in journal_lines[:5]: print(f&#x27; {line}') # Look "keyword">for volume/issue/page information volume_pattern = r&#x27;vol\.?\s*(\d+)|volume\s*(\d+)' issue_pattern = r&#x27;iss\.?\s*(\d+)|issue\s*(\d+)|no\.?\s*(\d+)' page_pattern = r&#x27;pp?\.?\s*([\d-]+)|pages?\s*([\d-]+)' year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19|20)\d{2}\b' volume_match = re.search(volume_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) issue_match = re.search(issue_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) page_match = re.search(page_pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) year_matches = re.findall(year_pattern, html_content) print(&#x27;\nPaper citation details extracted:') "keyword">if volume_match: volume = volume_match.group(1) "keyword">or volume_match.group(2) print(f&#x27; Volume: {volume}') "keyword">if issue_match: issue = issue_match.group(1) "keyword">or issue_match.group(2) "keyword">or issue_match.group(3) print(f&#x27; Issue: {issue}') "keyword">if page_match: pages = page_match.group(1) "keyword">or page_match.group(2) print(f&#x27; Pages: {pages}') "keyword">if year_matches: print(f&#x27; Years mentioned: {set(year_matches)}') # Try alternative search strategies based on extracted information print(&#x27;\n=== FORMULATING ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES ===') # Extract author names more precisely author_patterns = [ r&#x27;Çakmak[,\s]*Y[\s]*S', r&#x27;Güler[,\s]*G[\s]*Ö', r&#x27;Y[\s]*S[\s]*Çakmak', r&#x27;G[\s]*Ö[\s]*Güler' ] authors_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, html_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: authors_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if authors_found: print(f&#x27;Authors confirmed "keyword">in page: {set(authors_found)}') # Check "keyword">if there are authentication requirements auth_indicators = [ &#x27;login', 'sign "keyword">in', 'authenticate', 'institutional access', &#x27;subscription required', 'access denied', 'unauthorized' ] auth_issues = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in auth_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in html_content.lower(): auth_issues.append(indicator) "keyword">if auth_issues: print(f&#x27;\n*** AUTHENTICATION ISSUES DETECTED: {auth_issues} ***') print(&#x27;The ProQuest page may require institutional access "keyword">or subscription') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nNo obvious authentication barriers detected') # Look "keyword">for alternative sources "keyword">or mirrors mentioned print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ALTERNATIVE SOURCE INDICATORS ===') alternative_sources = [ &#x27;researchgate', 'academia.edu', 'semantic scholar', 'pubmed', &#x27;sciencedirect', 'springer', 'wiley', 'taylor', 'sage' ] found_alternatives = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in alternative_sources: "keyword">if source "keyword">in html_content.lower(): found_alternatives.append(source) "keyword">if found_alternatives: print(f&#x27;Alternative sources mentioned: {found_alternatives}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No alternative academic sources mentioned on page') # Save detailed analysis analysis_results = { &#x27;html_file_analyzed': html_file_path, &#x27;file_size_bytes': file_size, &#x27;content_length_chars': len(html_content), &#x27;paper_details': { &#x27;title_confirmed': 'trans fatty acid' "keyword">in html_content.lower() "keyword">and 'chocolate' "keyword">in html_content.lower(), &#x27;journal_confirmed': 'czech journal' "keyword">in html_content.lower(), &#x27;authors_found': list(set(authors_found)), &#x27;volume': volume_match.group(1) "keyword">or volume_match.group(2) "keyword">if volume_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;issue': issue_match.group(1) "keyword">or issue_match.group(2) "keyword">or issue_match.group(3) "keyword">if issue_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;pages': page_match.group(1) "keyword">or page_match.group(2) "keyword">if page_match "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;years_mentioned': list(set(year_matches)) "keyword">if year_matches "keyword">else [] }, &#x27;access_analysis': { &#x27;pdf_links_found': len(pdf_links), &#x27;authentication_issues': auth_issues, &#x27;alternative_sources_mentioned': found_alternatives }, &#x27;next_steps_recommended': [] } #
